title: A logical framework for data-driven reasoning
authors: Paolo Baldi, Esther Anna Corsi, Hykel Hosni
abstract:
We introduce and investigate a family of consequence relations with the goal
of capturing certain important patterns of data-driven inference. The inspiring
idea for our framework is the fact that data may reject, possibly to some
degree, and possibly by mistake, any given scientific hypothesis. There is no
general agreement in science about how to do this, which motivates putting
forward a logical formulation of the problem. We do so by investigating
distinct definitions of "rejection degrees" each yielding a consequence
relation. Our investigation leads to novel variations on the theme of rational
consequence relations, prominent among non-monotonic logics.
